strings.Value: "What happened to you?"
"I'm glad that's over with. Let's keep going!"
"What happened here?"
"Jaethal? How is it that you are here — and alive?"
"Tristian? What happened?"
"I don't want to have anything to do with Jaethal's murderer."
"What's done is done. Let's keep going."
"You're a murderer. I don't want your help!"
"Wrong. Get out."
"I think I'll let you stay, but only because I need all the help I can get to fight Nyrissa."
"Leave. We now go separate ways."
"Maybe you're right. You can stay, but only because I'm going to need your prayers."

{n}Jaethal tries to pretend nothing happened, but she breathes out, relieved. She literally breathes out — which means she is breathing...{/n} "Great. Everyone is back together again. I suppose now we can go look for that inventive nymph and deal with her once and for all?"

{n}Tristian sighs.{/n} "I'm ashamed to say it, but I fell for Nyrissa's lies yet again. She fooled me with an illusion, showing Jaethal killing innocent elves. I let rage overwhelm me, which happens to me rarely, as you know. But then... the lessons I learned from you, {name}, were not in vain. I remembered your wisdom and mercy for the innocent souls of the Kingdom of the Cleansed. I remembered how you {d|Jaethal Pharasma}convinced{/d} Jaethal to stop serving Urgathoa for the sake of her daughter's life. This stayed my hand."

"I was expecting you to ask." {n}The elf smiles a contented smile.{/n} "You see, my elegant {d|Jaethal Pharasma}performance{/d} in the elven camp didn't go unnoticed. When I rejected {g|Urgathoa}Urgathoa's{/g} gift, I mocked my former mistress. There is at least one deity who liked that very, very much. And we have one acquaintance among that deity's chosen who put in a word for me. So I was allowed to return — with a new mission and new goals. I'm not undead any more, but I'm still an inquisitor... An inquisitor of {g|Pharasma}Pharasma{/g}."

"Nyrissa wove an image of Tristian begging {g|Sarenrae}Sarenrae{/g} for my death. I might have believed the deception, if I hadn't known this righteous fool can't stop himself from trying to talk sense into everyone, even that stupid fanatic {d|Tristian Ruthgert Persuaded}Ruthgert{/d}. One minor detail: Nyrissa offered me {g|First World}First World{/g} immortality. Tempting, yes, but I didn't fancy falling under the power of a semi-insane nymph. Not to flatter you, {name}, but you're a far more worthy ruler and patron."

"As for Tristian... I'm sorry that I accidentally deprived you of this useful tool. I'd be happy to raise him as undead, but {g|Sarenrae}Sarenrae{/g} has already taken the soul. We don't want to wrestle with the Everlight."

As for Tristian... death is a part of the natural circle, and it's not the first time he's walked this road. I'm sorry that I involuntarily deprived you of a useful tool. But he showed once again that he's unreliable and easily manipulated. You have to face Nyrissa with the best — those you can truly rely on."

{n}Jaethal shrugs.{/n} "The naive boy-priest fell for Nyrissa's illusions and attacked me. The nymph tried to fool my mind as well. — She even offered me {g|First World}First World{/g} immortality, can you imagine? She failed, of course. Not to flatter you, {name}, but you are the only leader I'm ready to follow. You have the will and mind worthy of a ruler. It would be inexcusably stupid for me to exchange your favor for the whims of an insane nymph."
"Unwise. You should not squander your companions now, when you're under such desperate circumstances. Right?"
{n}Tristian is kneeling beside Jaethal's motionless body, quietly saying a prayer to {g|Sarenrae}Sarenrae{/g}. Noticing you, he jumps up.{/n} "{name}! You found the way! Praised be Sarenrae... I..."

{n}Jaethal is kneeling beside Tristian's body, lazily running her fingers through the dead priest's golden locks.{/n} "What a pity... he was a nullity in life, but it's sad to see resources wasted so."

{n}Jaethal and Tristian keep their distance from each other. Both of your companions look wearied from a fight, but both are alive. Tristian notices you first.{/n} "{name}! Praised be {g|Sarenrae}Sarenrae{/g}, you're alive!"
"Finally a well-reasoned position. Let's not waste time on idle talk and keep moving."
"If you insist..."

{n}Tristian frowns but replies, looking you firmly in the eye.{/n} "Both Jaethal and I fell for Nyrissa's lie. She fooled us with illusions and made us fight each other. And I was stronger. I never expected I..." {n}Tristian chuckles, tired and sorrowful.{/n} "I learned many lessons while traveling with you, and resilience was chief among them. Jaethal lacked it..."

"I want to tell you — this might sound cruel, but I don't regret what happened. I might have been driven by Nyrissa's lies, but for too long I'd turned a blind eye to what a monster Jaethal was, and how much harm she did. You've made it clear many times that indiscriminate forgiveness is not always the best solution. Well, I've learned this lesson."

"But so many questions remain... Jaethal was different when she returned from {d|Jaethal Pharasma}death{/d}. When I killed her she was a living creature, not undead. And the symbols on her weapon... it's marked by {g|Pharasma}Pharasma{/g}. Could it be that the Lady of Graves gave her a second chance for a more worthy life — only for me to take it? I don't know, and probably never will. But I'll have to live with it."
"I... understand. And yet I must ask you — are you sure you're ready to let me go now, when you're facing a battle with Nyrissa? I would like to stay and help you in this fight."
{n}Tristian lowers his head.{/n} "Then farewell, {name}. Nonetheless, I'll pray for your success."
"Then let's go — into the storm!"

{n}Tristian frowns but replies, looking you firmly in the eye.{/n} "Both Jaethal and I fell for Nyrissa's lies. She tricked us with illusions and made us fight each other. And I turned out to be the stronger. Death has never been so close to me, but I... I knew I must return to you. No matter what else."
